venue.name: Charles River Museum of Industry and Innovation

item.description:
The Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation is hosting
festival focusing on the innovations of the past.



Innovations of Yesteryear, a one-day festival produced by the Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation, in Waltham.

This hands-on event will feature an eclectic, interactive
assortment of innovations prior to 1970. Ride on a miniature
train, check out a gigantic camera, fire a Viking catapult, and
type a letter to your Nana on a vintage 1920s typewriter. Learn
the traditions of egg blowing and origami. We’ve got noisy
steam engines, putt-putt autos, musical instruments, sewing
machines, blacksmiths, antique sports & games, watches &
clocks, and more.

The event will take place — rain or shine — in Waltham’s Landry
Park, on the scenic banks of the Charles River.

Admission is $5 for adults, $3 for children, seniors, and
students; children under 5 are free. Festival admission
includes outdoor exhibits and museum galleries. Parking is
available across from the Festival at 16 Pine Street, Waltham.

For more information on any of the event please visit
Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation

The Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation is located
under the smokestack at 154 Moody Street in Waltham
item.how_to_find_us: meetup signage... I'll be near the entrance on the inside for 15 minutes or so.
item.name: Innovations of Yesteryear, Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
